intro: Navarretia involucrata, commonly known as the snowplant, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of silvery-white leaves and clusters of small, pinkish flowers. The plant is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or coastal areas. It is known for its ability to survive in harsh environments, including drought and cold temperatures. Navarretia involucrata is also noted for its short blooming period, typically in late winter to early spring.
